## About us

Since April 1, 2022 the advanced research computing training in Western Canada has been coordinated by the [Digital Research Alliance of Canada](https://alliancecan.ca) and [Simon Fraser University](https://www.sfu.ca/) in collaboration with other universities from British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan, and Manitoba.

::: {layout-ncol=6}
![](images/alex.jpg)
:::

Alex Razoumov earned his PhD in computational astrophysics from the University of British Columbia and held	postdoctoral positions in Urbana-Champaign, San Diego, Oak Ridge, and Halifax. He spent five years as HPC	Analyst in SHARCNET and in 2014 moved back to Vancouver to focus on scientific visualization and training researchers to use advanced computing tools. Alex is currently at Simon Fraser University.

::: {layout-ncol=6}
![](images/mh.jpg)
:::

Evolutionary and behavioural ecologist by training, [Software/Data Carpentry instructor](https://carpentries.org/), and open source advocate, [Marie-Hélène Burle](https://www.sfu.ca/~msb2/) develops and delivers training for researchers on high-performance computing tools (R, Python, Julia, Git, Bash scripting, machine learning, parallel scientific programming, and HPC) for [Simon Fraser University](https://www.sfu.ca/) and the [Digital Research Alliance of Canada](https://alliancecan.ca/). She is currently at Simon Fraser University.
